channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA

item.title: Report X-2025020265
item.description:
Report X-2025020265

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS FROSTED OVER AND EXTREMELY COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED 2.8 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PIZZA DOUGH. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING USED TO COOL THE DOUGH. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025020176
item.description:
Report X-2025020176

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-01
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered leaking. Further inspection reveals that it was an undeclared lead-acid battery that had a faulty seal on the top causing it to spill the acid. This is verified by the smell and litmus test.

item.title: Report X-2025020174
item.description:
Report X-2025020174

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-31
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found with wet spots and smelled of gasoline. Further inspection reveals that they were pumps that had a fuel dump that still contained fuel, that when tipped, leaked out of a hole where a sensor was supposed to be. The sensor had been unscrewed prior to transportation. There was no indicator that the package contained DG making it undeclared.

item.title: Report X-2025011307
item.description:
Report X-2025011307

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-30
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The can of primers cap was improperly sealed. The cap is cross threaded which led to the can to leak out a small portion of its contents during shipment. There are no external marking on the package and the limited quantity marking is found only on the inside of the package.
